subside.translation[0].definitions[0].de: if a feeling, pain, sound etc subsides, it gradually becomes less and then stops
subside.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Simon waited until the laughter subsided.
The pains in his head had subsided, but he still felt dizzy and sick.
subside.translation[0].definitions[1].de: if a building or an area of land subsides, it gradually sinks to a lower level
subside.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: After the heavy rains, part of the road subsided.
subside.translation[0].definitions[2].de: if bad weather conditions subside, they gradually return to a normal state
subside.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: The wind gradually subsided, and all was quiet.
subside.translation[0].definitions[3].de: if water, especially flood water, subsides, it gradually goes underground or back to a normal level
subside.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: When the floods subsided, the streets were littered with bodies.
